*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James F. and Emily Perry, April 19, 1833. Business memoranda and instructions. Desire to found an academy. Debt to Anthony Butler paid. Eleven-league grants.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="04-19-1833">April 19. 1833*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr *person_mentioned*Brother */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*I send you *person_mentioned*Simon */person_mentioned*and wish you to keep him at work on the *location_mentioned*farm*/location_mentioned* untill I return He is a good *person_mentioned*field hand */person_mentioned*and will help out very much with the crop.*/p*
*p*I have some steers and work oxen on *location_mentioned*peach creek*/location_mentioned*. They run at or *location_mentioned*near *person_mentioned*Isham Phillips*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Mr. Mathis*/person_mentioned* wants to buy one of the work oxen. Also *location_mentioned*near *person_mentioned*Slaughter*/person_mentioned*s on the Bernard*/location_mentioned* there are some, and some at *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Rabb*/person_mentioned*s place*/location_mentioned*. They are all of the *person_mentioned*Rabb */person_mentioned*stock and I believe are branded with my brand. Send and get them or sell them. They will do for beef. There are some cows among them. Your mule is *location_mentioned*in the prairie below here*/location_mentioned* with *person_mentioned*Urbain*/person_mentioned*'s horses and I have a mule in my brand *location_mentioned*on the same range*/location_mentioned*. I sold the horses I had at *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Coles*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned* to *person_mentioned*S. P. Brown*/person_mentioned*. There is a number of head of cattle in the *location_mentioned*prairie*/location_mentioned* that *person_mentioned*Hunter */person_mentioned*collected for me. *person_mentioned*Fletcher */person_mentioned*has the list of them $122. worth—all these scattered cattle ought to be got together and taken to *location_mentioned*peach point*/location_mentioned* or they will be lost. There is 100 head or more. Have them collected and take them below or sell them. I think you could get *person_mentioned*James Baird*/person_mentioned* to collect them.*/p*
*p*I leave my business with *person_mentioned*Williams */person_mentioned*and have authorized *person_mentioned*John Austin*/person_mentioned* to sell the *location_mentioned*lots in Brasoria*/location_mentioned* and a *location_mentioned*labor at the mouth of the river*/location_mentioned* etc. I have *location_mentioned*three eleven league grants*/location_mentioned* in the name of *person_mentioned*Aguirre and Vega*/person_mentioned* that I bought last year. They are in *person_mentioned*Williams */person_mentioned*hands. Also *person_mentioned*Juan Antonio Padilla*/person_mentioned* contracted three leagues of his *location_mentioned*grant */location_mentioned*to me in payment of about $2000 that I let him have *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1830">three years ago*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John P. Coles*/person_mentioned* is to make me a title for *location_mentioned*three leagues and a half of his tract fronting on the Brassos*/location_mentioned*. It is first rate bottom land *location_mentioned*just above the Yeagua*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I have paid off*person_mentioned* Anthony Butler */person_mentioned*in full and got *person_mentioned*James Whitesides */person_mentioned*receipt against the two notes of mine that *person_mentioned*Butler */person_mentioned*has—the other notes I took up. I have also paid off *person_mentioned*George Tennelle*/person_mentioned* in full and *person_mentioned*Hunter*/person_mentioned* and leave no debts that are pressing, nor any, of any amount due to any one. One of the *person_mentioned*Tennel */person_mentioned*notes is yet out in the*location_mentioned* U. S.*/location_mentioned* he passed it away before he came here. I also Owe $400 to *person_mentioned*Lovelace */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Ouchita */location_mentioned*that I borrowed in *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1821">1821*/date_mentioned*. There is a debt of about $400 due by my *person_mentioned*brothers estate*/person_mentioned* to the *person_mentioned*Estate of Luciano Garcia in *location_mentioned*Tamaulipas */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*for a cavallarda of mares—I am bound for this debt. I think that $4000 will now square me with the world including interest.*/p*
*p*This trip to *location_mentioned*mexico*/location_mentioned* interferes very much with me—in two months more I could have closed all my business and gone to work below improving a *location_mentioned*farm */location_mentioned*and I intended to do so, and have settled myself along side of you permanently—I shall now spend the whole *date_mentioned n="Summer-1833">summer */date_mentioned*away at least. It is a great sacrifice indeed. I also expect that this trip will cost me about $2000 or 8000 at least which of course will never be refunded. But if I can succeed in getting a State Govt and the *date_mentioned n="04-06-1830">6 of April*/date_mentioned* law repealed I shall be well paid and perfectly satisfied. If I fail I shall loose my time and money and risk my health and life, and get repaid (very likely) in abuse and illiberal reflections. This however is all quite natural—so it is with all who serve the *person_mentioned*Sovereign people*/person_mentioned*, they are the hardest masters on earth.*/p*
*p*Should *person_mentioned*troops */person_mentioned*be stationed *location_mentioned*at the mouth of the river*/location_mentioned* it will make money plenty and a sale for provisions which will benefit the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*—tho I hope but few will be sent for I fear they can not harmonise with the people. I shall try and keep them away if I can. The *person_mentioned*officers */person_mentioned*are generally very polite and gentlemenly men and if they spoke English there would be no difficulty with them.*/p*
*p*I enter upon this mission with great anxiety for I am convinced the welfare of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned* depends on success. We cannot do without a *person_mentioned*State govt*/person_mentioned*, any longer. It is impossible, the events of *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1832">last year*/date_mentioned* have so completely disjointed matters that nothing but a *person_mentioned*State gov*/person_mentioned*. will set them right again—and a *location_mentioned*state */location_mentioned*we must have. If every thing had remained quiet untill now our chance of success would have been better, but as the current is in motion it must flow on, and if we cannot get a *location_mentioned*state */location_mentioned*by peaceable means, I shall then unite with the hottest to get one by other means. If we are to have war, we must all go together, there must be no divisions amongst us, but I hope that calamity will never fall upon *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*. Tell *person_mentioned*McNiel */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Westail*/person_mentioned* that when I return with the state approved they must give a State frolic. The *person_mentioned*girls */person_mentioned*must not get married untill then. My love to them and to you all. Farewell.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
